title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 13 March - BBC News
summary: man threatened with machete while holding child .
dumped rubbish still not removed four years on .
man accused of raping and murdering 72-year-old woman .
eight flee arson attack at clumber park .
call to screen ex-miners for lung disease .
winston churchill cigar butt to be sold .
cricket : derbyshire return for wright and cork .

documents.title: in sunrise over yorkshire
text: there has been a beautiful sunrise across yorkshire this morning .
it 's been captured by some of our bbc weather watchers .
top left is northallerton , top right is wakefield , bottom right is misterton and bottom left is kirk smeaton .

documents.title: man 'raped and smothered woman , 72 '
text: man 'raped and smothered woman , 72 '
author: Caroline Lowbridge
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage for this region has now ended for tuesday , but some news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear overnight .
east midlands live will return from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: man 'raped and smothered 72-year-old woman '
text: a man raped and murdered a 72-year-old woman by smothering her with a pillow , a court has heard .
craig keogh , 27 , is also accused of stealing jewellery and cash from jane hings ' home and using it to buy a carvery and rounds of drinks .
birmingham crown court heard he attacked ms hings at her bungalow in fleckney , leicestershire , after a night out when he had been taking cocaine .
mr keogh , of no fixed address , denies all of the charges .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: gritters heading out despite rise in temperatures
text: nottinghamshire county council tweets
winter 's not over yet .
a colder night in store than the last few days with road temps expected to drop to around zero .
we 're therefore planning to grit main routes from 8pm # grittertwitter
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: forest boss thanks fans for 'crucial ' support
text: nottingham forest manager aitor karanka tweets
6 games putting points on the board .
your support is crucial .
on the right track and eager for more and better .
# nffc
glad you have improved the defence but we are creating nothing .
the derby game was tedious .
no chances .
no shots on target .
where is mckay ?
we need to open up the opposition .
no runners from midfield arriving late
rome was n't built in a day
will most of the loanees leave in the summer ?
you give poets reasons to write .
artists the inspiration to paint .
drinkers something to celebrate .
please never leave .
my heart could n't take it x
it hurts like hell believe me , my heart is still broken a year on .
however i take comfort from the fact that the @ twitterid magic is touching more people .
he is the most beautiful man , treasure him
he does amazing things for the people who need him most .
i can not thank him enough , but i 'll spend a lifetime trying .
sorry for your loss , but appreciate that you can share our joy .
what is almost overwhelming is that the best is yet to come .
be still , my beating heart .
« roma no fue construida en un día , pero aitor no estaba en ese trabajo en particular . »
bien hecho para ti , el jefe .
has creado un equipo de un desastre .
roma no fue construida en un día .
mantente fuerte y ten un plan !
vamos rojos # nffc
keep up the good work , king karanka - doing a superb job
great work so far gaffer
we r behind u all the way aitor
@ twitterid well said boss # nffc
what do you think about this @ twitterid ( ? )
come on @ twitterid come on @ twitterid !
brilliant so far
love this guy .
future looking good and we made a 32 million pound profit so can spend a little in the summer # nffc
we are nottingham say we are nottingham we need to sign that foreign lad soudani
i love you aitor , 100 % faith in you
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: pair arrested after car hits chinese takeaway
text: a man and a woman have been arrested after a vehicle crashed into the front of a takeaway in mansfield .
police said it happened at around 12:40 this afternoon at canton restaurant on ravensdale road after the car failed to stop for routine checks on eakering road .
no one was injured .
the 31-year-old man was arrested on sus of dangerous driving , failing to stop , having no licence or insurance and vehicle theft .
the 27-year-old woman was arrested on sus of vehicle theft .
the pair remain in police custody .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: pollution hotspots revealed
text: pollution hotspots revealed

documents.title: town centre crossing set for upgrade
text: a pedestrian crossing is being upgraded as part of a £ 1.7m scheme to improve links between ilkeston town centre and its railway station .
the crossing , on manners road between bath street and pelham avenue , is being converted from a puffin to a toucan crossing .
puffin crossings are for pedestrians and dismounted cyclists .
toucan crossings are wider to allow pedestrians and mounted cyclists to cross together .
councillor simon spencer , from the county council , said : `` these better connected routes will make it easier for people to get to work and other services . ''
work on the crossing is expected to be completed by friday 23 march .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham forest 0-0 derby county
text: nottingham forest 0-0 derby county
author: Owen Phillips
BBC Sport

documents.title: where science meets art
text: most people consider themselves with either an artistic or scientific brain - but those worlds are colliding in a new exhibition at the newark houses museum in leicester .
it 's called brief encounters - it opened over the weekend as part of leicester university 's celebration of science week .
this is one of the pieces on display from jeweller kate bajic :

documents.title: cricket : libby top scores in friendly
text: nottinghamshire ccc tweets
yorkshire finished day one on 305-6 .
at the end of the final day , nottinghamshire have posted 195-5 with @ twitterid retiring not out on 75 and @ twitterid adding 34
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: charity bid helps save narrow boat scheme
text: a programme that helps young people get experience on the region 's waterways has been saved from closure .
the nottingham narrowboat project has been operating since 1974 , but had been under threat because of funding cuts .
it has successfully applied to become a charity and has secured £ 10,000 from the big lottery fund .
carl bloch , who operates one of the project 's two narrow boats , said : `` people do come on the boats and they do get an experience .
`` it is something that you ca n't actually put a financial value on . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: watch : dumped rubbish still not removed four years on
text: a huge pile of waste , dumped on land opposite homes in newark , is still there , almost four years after it was first discovered .
the 900-tonne pile of household and commercial waste remains at the site on bowbridge road despite attempts by the environment agency and district council to get it removed .
the authority said although an environment agency investigation found the waste was illegal , there was insufficient evidence to prosecute .
however , residents remain frustrated that nothing has been done and have told the bbc it encourages rats .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: girl left traumatised after abduction bid
text: girl left traumatised after abduction bid

documents.title: your photos : magnificent chatsworth
text: the chatsworth estate is looking gorgeous this afternoon .
congratulations to joanna shimwell for taking this fantastic photo .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: ken clarke calls for tax overhaul to fund healthcare
text: ken clarke has suggested higher taxes for older wealthy workers to pay for improvements in health and social care .
the rushcliffe mp made the comments following chancellor philip hammond 's spring statement .
mr clarke said : `` it is absurd that older employees pay less tax than younger colleagues because they do n't pay national insurance . ''
currently , workers stop some contributions towards national insurance at state pension age .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham 's hospitals to be featured on bbc two
text: a documentary series going behind the scenes of nottingham 's hospitals will air later this month , it has been revealed .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: power cut in somercotes
text: at least 77 homes and businesses have been hit by a power cut in somercotes .
western power distribution is aiming to have electricity back on by 18:30 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: burgers , cheese and cider on thief 's shopping list
text: this little lot was recovered by police officers after they arrested a suspected shop thief in long eaton .
the town 's neighbourhood policing team said the man was detained following a short foot chase .
after a short foot chase , one male detained and on his way to custody after a series of shop thefts around # longeaton # notonmywatch
first bbq of the year
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: photo appeal after shop worker attacked by rolex thief
text: photos have been released of a man police want to speak to following a robbery at a jewellery shop in nottingham .
a staff member was assaulted and a rolex was taken during the raid at cope in upper parliament street on 9 february .
the robber had visited the store earlier to browse watches and take photos .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: chesterfield player charged over road crash
text: a former spireite whose stay at the club was halted by a car crash has been charged with driving without due care and attention .
author: Derbyshire Times

documents.title: 'friendly ' pet rat found in field
text: a domestic rat is being looked after by the rspca in chesterfield after being found in a field .
the pet has been named midge by staff at the charity , who 've described her as `` friendly '' .

inspector john gibson said : at this stage we do not know if she escaped or if she was dumped but i suspect it was the latter as she was in the middle of a field with no houses around to suggest she is a stray .
luckily the passerby spotted she was a domestic rat as she is so friendly and came running over to greet her . ''
the rspca has appealed for information on where the rat came from but if no owner is found staff plan to find her a new home .
the charity said it took in 228 rats last year , up from 204 in 2016 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: giant moon suspended in cathedral nave
text: giant moon suspended in cathedral nave

documents.title: widow of football legend hit at match
text: widow of football legend hit at match

documents.title: nottingham delegation in cannes 'to boost investment '
text: a delegation of business leaders are in the upmarket french resort of cannes to encourage investment in nottingham .
they are visiting mipim , the world 's largest property event .
delegates at the show include nottingham trent university , nottingham bid , the university of nottingham and the city council .
lorraine baggs , from invest in nottingham , said : `` team nottingham is stronger than ever before for 2018 and we are looking forward to showcasing what the city has to offer at mipim .
`` the private and public sector will be working together in collaboration , not only to raise nottingham 's profile but also to bring forward key development schemes for the city . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: newton tree 'clones ' to inspire students
text: newton tree 'clones ' to inspire students

documents.title: derbyshire return for wright and cork
text: derbyshire return for wright and cork

documents.title: call to screen ex-miners for lung disease
text: the government has dismissed calls from an mp for ex-miners to be routinely screened for the lung disease , pneumoconiosis .
ben bradley , mp for mansfield , raised the issue during a debate in parliament .
he said : `` this is not an abstract discussion , this is a disease that affects a large number of former miners , including in my mansfield constituency .
`` it is a progressive disease but if sufferers are diagnosed at an early stage then they can receive care and support quickly and access the compensation and benefits they deserve . ''
the work and pensions minister sarah newton said : `` the view was very clearly expressed by medical experts that introducing a screening process would not be beneficial .
`` when pneumoconiosis is identified often no treatment is required .
when it is severe there is no specific treatment available . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: do n't jail people behind racial chanting , student says
text: a woman who tweeted a video of racist chanting in her university halls has said the people behind it should not be jailed .
two 18-year-old men have been arrested on sus of racially aggravated public order offences after the footage from a nottingham trent university residence emerged .
rufaro chisango , told itv 's this morning : `` if anything does happen they should n't go to jail .
`` i feel like what they have been through now is enough . ''
a spokesperson for nottinghamshire police said the two men had been released under investigation .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: man arrested after botched robbery in chaddesden
text: a 32-year-old man has been arrested on sus of holding up an off-licence in chaddesden with a gun .
police said a man demanded money at broomhalls in wiltshire road just after 18:00 yesterday and tried to take a crate of beer , but dropped it when challenged by the shopkeeper .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : raging river in chesterfield
text: heavy rain yesterday led to high river levels across derbyshire , viki the blue sent us this photo from chesterfield .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: racing at southwell
text: the eyes of the racing world may be on cheltenham , but there is also an all-weather meeting at southwell .
the seven-race card gets underway at 13:10 , with the final run at 17:00 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: bugs and fleas made accommodation 'the house from hell '
text: a father-of-two has said he has been living in the house from hell '' since he moved in and discovered it was `` full of bugs and fleas '' .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: councillors barred from voting over council tax arrears
text: three erewash councillors were barred from voting on their authority 's budget last week - because they had n't paid all of their council tax .
conservative councillors andrew mccandless , daniel walton and peter pepios were in arrears .
it 's the second year in a row mr mccandless has been barred from voting on the budget for that reason .
the conservative group leader carol hart said : i do n't know the personal circumstance and i do n't really want to know .

`` if they have had difficulties , they 've spoken to our finance team , they 've agreed a payment scheme and as long as they 've not broken any laws or done anything wrong , then i 'd prefer not to interfere on that . ''

the labour opposition leader , james dawson , said : if you 're going to put yourself forward for elected office you 've got to lead by example and i think it 's quite bad if you 've got members who are n't paying their council tax . ''
it is an offence for a councillor in council tax arrears ( with at least two months unpaid bills ) to vote in meetings on financial matters relating to council tax .
radio derby 's been told mr mccandless wo n't be standing for re-election next year but he did n't want to comment .
mr pepios and mr walton did n't respond to our request for a comment .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: black students share experience of racism
text: black students share experience of racism

documents.title: logo chosen for owen jenkins water safety scheme
text: a logo has been chosen for an education programme set up in memory of a 12-year-old boy who drowned trying to save a girl .
owen jenkins , from beeston rylands , died in july last year after going into the water at beeston weir to try to save two girls who had got into difficulty .
he managed to save one girl , but when he went back into the water to save the other , he was taken by the current and went under the water .
following his death , owen 's mum nicola set up the owen trust - a programme to educate young people about water safety .
the logo for the scheme was designed by nottingham college student phatcharaphon temjit , with owen 's mum , having beaten more than 30 other designs in a competition .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: record-breaking amount of litter on a38
text: a council says its annual clean-up of the a38 through amber valley is on track to bring in its largest ever haul of litter .
after just two days of the operation , a large container had already been filled with discarded boxes , tubs , tyres and bin bags .
amber valley borough council is partially closing the dual carriageway every sunday in march for the clean-up .
chris short , who 's in charge of environmental affairs at the authority , said : `` our fears about the level of littering this year have been confirmed .
`` this huge clean-up will cost us between £ 30,000 and £ 35,000 , and if motorists would only dispose of their litter more appropriately , it 's money we could be spending elsewhere . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: cricket : nottinghamshire launch 2018 kits
text: nottinghamshire have unveiled their new kits for the 2018 season .
the outlaws will wear a collared shirt ( far right ) for the royal london one-day cup and a v-neck for the vitality t20 blast .
the white county championship shirt remains the same as 2017 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: teenage girl 'pulled by headscarf and kicked in face '
text: a 41-year-old woman and a 12-year-old girl have been interviewed by police after a teenager was allegedly assaulted and racially abused in boulton .
the 13-year-old girl told officers she was pulled to the floor by her headscarf and kicked in the face during the attack in stanley road on 5 march .
derbyshire police said the woman and girl had attended a voluntary interview and their investigations were continuing .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: notts players pay tribute to cricket commentator
text: a solemn moment before notts and yorkshire resume their pre-season friendly in potchefstroom , south africa .
both yorkshire & notts stood for a minute 's silence this morning to remember @ twitterid commentator dave callaghan - rip dave .
# youryorkshire
such sad news .
one of the best .
not playing though surely ?
i probably heard this man commentating at some time but certainly did n't know him but today 's twitter tributes tell me what a top , highly respected man he obviously was .
rip dc
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: hundreds of school pupils record song for derbyshire
text: more than 1,700 school pupils from across derbyshire have teamed up to release a single to raise money for music education in the county .
the best that you can be was written using lyric suggested by the children themselves and references the peak district , derby county , chatsworth house and cromford mills .
it was put together by the derbyshire music education hub - a collaboration of various local musical organisations - and features young singers and musicans from 46 schools .
you can listen to their finished effort here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: rams boss rallies fans for final nine games
text: derby county boss gary rowett has issued a rallying cry for rams fans to get behind the team for the final nine games of the season .
it comes after a run of poor form has seen his side lose touch with the automatic promotion places in the championship .
he said : `` we 're still four points in the play-offs with a superior goal difference to anyone else and nine exciting games to come .
we 've got to try and embrace that as a club .
`` i know we all want top two but the reality is now we 've got to focus on what 's available which i think is probably the play-offs . ''
derby 's next game is cardiff city at home on sunday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: winston churchill cigar butt to be auctioned in derbyshire
text: a cigar once smoked by winston churchill is expected to fetch hundreds when it goes under the hammer in derbyshire later this month .

it 's being sold by mike wood , from belper , who said it had been given to his father in about 1952 when his duties as a policeman included checking all was well with churchill 's country home near kent .

mr wood said : `` they 'd call in there and make sure everything was in order and , during one of those trips to chartwell , someone in the house gave my father the cigar butt which had been smoked by winston himself . ''
the historic butt will be auctioned on 27 march with an estimate of £ 500-£ 700 .
hansons valuer jim spencer ( said : `` it 's an iconic piece of churchill memorabilia because he was so often holding a cigar . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man threatened with machete while holding child
text: a man has told police robbers threatened him with a machete while he was holding his child at his home in ruddington .
he said three masked men forced entry to the house in leys road at about 20:30 on saturday night and took cash , jewellery and a car .
police have asked for the public 's help in finding the robbers , who were dressed in black and arrived in a dark coloured vehicle .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: log flume fish pond sells for £ 144
text: an old log flume from the american adventure theme park that was being used as a raised fishpond has sold for £ 144 at an auction .
the carbon fibre boat was put up for sale by lorraine pike , from sutton , whose mother kept it outside her home in alfreton prior to her recent death .
it had been converted after being sold off when the attraction closed for good in 2007 .
she said there had been a lot of interest in the one-day online auction and its new owner was considering turning it into a raised flower bed .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a much drier day and with milder temperatures it will feel like spring .
author: Mel Coles
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: traffic and travel : m1 fully reopened
text: there 've been problems on the m1 between j30 and j31 this morning - but things appear to be improving .
repairs on the road have been completed and all lanes have reopened :
traffic officers and contractors in attendance # m1 j30 to j31 northbound , repair of the carriageway defect has commenced .

documents.title: eight flee arson attack at clumber park
text: police say a suspected arson attack at clumber park yesterday may be linked to criminal damage to a historic bridge at the park the previous week .
eight people who were staying inside a barn had to flee when it was set on fire at about 00:30 .
a national trust van and a nearby bin were also set alight but there were no injuries .

neighbourhood inspector neil bellamy said : `` it 's so disheartening that clumber park has been maliciously targeted for the second weekend in a row and this time it could have had far more serious consequences .
`` officers have been making substantial leads on both incidents and we are keeping an open mind as to whether the same people are behind them both . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: join us for today 's live updates
text: good morning everyone .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the east midlands throughout today .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
